rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Light absorption as a means of measuring particle size and consistency.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The measurement of particle size 1s important industrially. Among other applications may be mentioned its use in the grinding of ores and in the manufacture of Pulp and Paper. Investigations have been in progress for some time in the Physical Chemistry department of McG111 University, their object being the measurement of particle size by a light absorption method. Recently a new apparatus and technique were proposed: this investigation deals, in the first place, with an examina tion of the scope and sensitivity of this new apparatus and with the relation of its results to those of a previous apparatus. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: CAROTENE AND VITAMIN A.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Not many years after Hopkins had first prophesied that advance in the study of nutritional problems would concern itself largely with certain unknown dietary factors, (now calledvitamins), his prediction was fulfilled. In 1912, McCollum discovered and named the "fat-soluble vitamin", designating it "A" almost simultaneously with the similar discovery of Osborne and Mendel. {56,57). This dietary factor, found to be abundant in butter and cod liver oil, is essential for the growth of young animals, and for the maintenance of normal nutrition and health in all animals. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The viscosity of gases.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Clasaical problems of the kinetic theory of gases fall into two divisions- namely, those problems which deal with a uniform gas, and those which are concerned with a gas which is not uniform in composition, mean velocity or energy. The present work deals with the latter. The keystone of the kinetic theory of gases is the development of the law of distribution of molecular velocities. This was done by Maxwell for the case of a uniform gas; and by means of his well known law the pressure and temperature of a gas can be expressed in terms of the moleoular data. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: L’histoire dans le théâtre d’Alexandre Dumas père.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Un jour, à sept heures du matin, Dumas se rendlt chez le baron Taylor, commissaire royal près du Theåtre-Français. 1l portait avec lui un drame hlstorique qu'il venait d'écrire, intitulé "Christine". Dumas, à cette époque était encore inconnu des cercles littéraires, mais, malgré son obscurité, le baron Taylor avait consenti à écouter la lecture de son oeuvre. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: French.
Dumas, Alexandre, 1802-1870 -- Criticism and interpretation.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The motility of the gastrointestinal tract of elasmobranch fishes.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The experimental work embodied in the following thesis has been carried out during the last four years and has been published from time to time in varions journals, as each phasewas brought to completion. These experiments were designed to investigate the reaction of the gastro-intestinal tract to temperature variations, to the action of drugs, such as adrenaline, pilocarpine, acetylcholine, atropine and ergotoxine, and, finally, to sympathetic and parasympathetic nerve stimulation. For the last an anatomical, histological and physiological study of the vascular supply of the gastro-intestinal tract was necessary, because, as will be shown, the sympathetic nerves are distributed to the gut by means of periarterial nerve plexuses. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Gastrointestinal system -- Motility.
Chondrichthyes.
Physiology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The petrology of Grenville limestone contacts with certain intrusives, St. Jerome, P.Q.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis is a study of the effects produced by the intrusion of a basic magna into an impure crystalline limestone. The small area under consideration was mapped and photographs taken of the outcrops. A petrographic study of thin sections was made and photomicrographs taken of the various rock types. From the results obtained during this work, conclusions were arrived at which have a bearing on the theory of the origin of alkaline rocks. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The action of the preparations from the posterior lobe of the pituitary globe upon the imbibition of water by frogs.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: During the past fifteen years several investigators have shown that commercial or laboratory preparations of the posterior lobe of the pituitary gland when injected into frogsgive rise to a transient increase in weight. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Pharmacology.
Frogs -- Physiology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Tetrachlorophthalimide as a reagent in qualitative organic analysis.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The qualitative identification of organic halogen compounds has always been a matter of difficulty. For many years the only method was dependent upon the physical constantsof the compound, such as melting and boiling point, refractive index, and density, in combination with a quantitative estimation of the halogen. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A study of some problems in radio interference.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In the early days of wireless reception the sheer idea was so novel, so apparently miraculous that its many imperfections were taken as a matter of course, if not unnoticed. A transmission and reception process was highly successful if the listener reported the voices as clearly distinguishable. Whether it is the approach to perfection in all the other mechanisms of our modern life or the intensified competition experienced during depression years by all manufacturers of commodities not essential to human existence or yet the fact that the novelty has worn off man's most recent toy -- the state of affairs now exists where Mr. Householder will not pay his good fifty dollarsfor anything that will not bring to his fireside everything offered by the B.B.C. or C.R.C. in aural perfection. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Electrical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Some entozoa found in certain amphibia in Quebec province.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This study was undertaken to endeavour to fill the need for a general survey of the Entozoa found in certain Amphibia - frogs, toads and newts - found in the Province of Quebec,especially in the vicinity of Montreal. Investigations of isolated groups of the fauna found in Amphihia have been made in North America, particularly in the United States, but there is a distinct lack of general surveys and more complete records of the associations in which these Entozoa occur. The present research includes descriptjon of the Entozoa of several species of Amphibia collected in the Province of Quebec, the interactions of these Entozoa and their hosts and a discussion of the typical associations in which they occur. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Zoology.
Helminths -- Québec (Province)
Amphibians -- Québec (Province)

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Some observations on the bionomics of Ascaris Lumbricoides.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: May of the the major problems in Parasitology such as the in vivo habits and in vitro cultivation of helminths, are handicapped by a lack of knowledge of the fundamentalprocesses which these phenomena involve. Experimental investigation in Bionomics has been directed chiefly to a study of the optimum developmental temperature of the various life cycle stages; maximum and minimum temperatures which eggs and larvae can withstand, their resistance to desiccation and the like. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Parasitology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Gottfried Keller als Erzaehler.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In dieser Arbeit war mein Bestreben, die organische Entwicklung der Kunst Gottfried Kellers und die engen Beziehungen von Leben und Kunst darzustellen, und zwar zuerst in den einzelnen TIerken und dann in Zusammenfassung, mit besonderer Berücksichtigung der grössten bildenden Einflüss auf die Persönlichkeit und das Schaffen des Epikers, Ethike und Humoristen. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: German.
Keller, Gottfried, 1819-1890.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Teacher training in the province of Quebec : a historical study (to 1857)
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: To understand the educational situation in any community, then, it w1ll be necessary, among other considerations, to know what sort of teachers they have, what training they require of them and what tests of character and scholarship they impose. And to fully appreciate the meaning of information on these subjects, it will be of real value to know something of the historical development that is back of the present requirements. In the Province of Quebec, where so much of the situation in regard to education presents quite unique features, a historical study of the development of teacher training will make its contribution to the understanding of the whole situation. It is with that in mind that this thesis has been written. It is my purpose to trace the evidences of teacher training in the French Regime in this Province; from that, to fo1low the various attempts to develop national schools after the conquest and to discover what traces there are of teacher training there. Towards the end of the period, we must note various training institutions, both of voluntary societies and of the government, which had varying degrees of success. This study will be brought to a conclusion with the opening of the three Normal Schools of 1857 which were the beginning of our present system.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Education
Teachers -- Training of -- Québec (Province) -- History.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A study of the carbonaceous matter of maple syrup which is precipitated by basic lead acetate
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Food Science and Agricultural Chemistry
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: When a solution of basic lead acetate is added to a maple syrup solution, a heavy, voluminous precipitate is formed which varies in colour from a dark brown to almost white. Malates, colouring and other organic matter as well as some inorganic constituents are precipitated by the reagent. A quantitative study of this precipitate has resulted in a number of determinations which are used to detect adulteration in maple products. Previous investigators have found the precipitate to be quite high in organic matter but were able to account for about 50 percent of the carbon only. The purpose of this investigation was to isolate organic compounds which would account at least in part, for the remaining oarbon.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agricultural chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Physical properties of clay and clay-salt mixtures
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The use of common salt as a means of stabilizing roads on the North American continent has been receiving increasing attention of recent years. Salt has been used with clay in this way to give a compact, durable and dustproof surface to earth roads. It has been employed also for treating the subgrade of highways in preparation for surfacing with asphalt or concrete. The following research was undertaken mainly for the purpose of ascertaining the effect of salt upon the freezing point of clay. Tests have been made with varying proportions of clay, water, and salt, and the consequent lowering of the freezing point has been determined in each case.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Civil engineering and applied mechanics

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: An investigation of timber tension splices
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The tension splice in timber construction is probably the most troublesome to design and frame efficiently, of all timber joints. This thesis treats of an effort to develop an efficient bolted steel fish plate splice which might be effectively used for such temporary structures as falsework, small timber trusses, and construction trestles where assembly is usually effected by unskilled or semi-skilled labour and shop fabrication is impracticable. Other requisites of such a splice being that the material employed should be both inexpensive and readily available.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Civil engineering and applied mechanics

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Geiger-Müller counters for induced radioactivity.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The first part of this thesis concerns the Geiger-Muller counters. After a general desoription of their operation, the orilinal papers of Geiger and MUller are reviewed, as wellas other papers describing the nature of the discharge, The different types of tube Gounter that have been designed are given in the next section. The "efficiency" of the counteris considered, with references to some previous papers. The next section deals with the characteristics of the counters built. Curves are gIven showing the variation with pressureand voltage of the rate of counting. The efficienoy of the counter is tested by the decay of Radium Active Deposit and the inverse square law. The "absolute efficienoy" of thecounter is determined by the law of probability. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The structure of lignin.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Up to the present time numerous investigators have prepared lignin by a variety of methods. In their preparation drastic reagents have, in general, been employed and only a small percentage of the total lignin present in the wood has been isolated. This has long been recognized by Hibbert and coworkers but, in spite of the successes previously achieved, no satisfactory solution has yet been found. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Cyto-genetic studies of compactoid and speltoid mutations in Triticum vu/gare Host.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: There are among the hexaploid Triticums three species differing markedly with respect to such characters as height of haulm, density of ear and shape of glume. T. spelta L. has longer haulms, looser ears and squarer glumes than has T. vulgare Host. which in turn differs in a similar manner and degree from T. compactum Host. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Genetics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Effects of unbalanced voltage on synchronous motor operation.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Introducing the subjeot of this paper we must first explain what is meant by the terms "unbalanoed voltage" and "effects", and then show why this problem arises. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Electrical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: La survivance française dans la Nouvelle-Angleterre
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: D’un bout à l'autre du continent, la terre d’Amérique fut d'abord une terre française et catholique. Canadiens français, par conséquent, Acadiens et Franco-Américains colons de langue française établis aux États-Unis ou dans les possessions américaines, sont taus membres de la même famille. lIs ont tous une origine commune. Un très grand nombre de Canadiens-Français ont fondé des villes aux États-Unis. A Montreal naquit Pierre Lemoyne d'Iberville, fondateur de la Louisiane et de Mobile (Alabama). A la Rivière du Loup naquit John McLaughlin le fondateur deL’Oregon. Le fondateur de St. Charles (Missouri), Louis Blanchette, naquit à Saint-Henri-de-Lauzon.[…] . Le maire de Los Angeles (California), I'un des plus illustres pionniers, Prudent Beaudry, naquit à Sainte Anne-des-Plaines. Le fondateur de Detroit (Michigan), Lamothe-Cadillac, vécut à Montreal. L'migration du groupe Canadiens-français et du groupe Acadien aux États-Unis remonte à l'origine même de la République. Dès la déclaration de I'independence, un grand nombre d'entre-eux, hostile à l'Angleterre, et par sympathie pour la France, prirent de service dans l'armée de Washington. A cette époque le Canada donna sa contribution à la République naissante.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: French-Canadians -- New England.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Ecological aspects of the pasture-conditioned climax in the eastern townships of Quebec.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Livestock farming is the staple industry in many parts of the province of Quebec. The region designated as the Eastern Townships is one of the best known districts in Canada for dairying and stock raising. To this region, pastures, therefore, become of fundamental importance, farmers depending on them to furnish keep for their cattle for a period of 150 to 170 days from May to October each year. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agronomy.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Les idées dans le théâtre de François de Curel.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Quand André Antoine fit représenter en 1892 l'Envers d'une Sainte, premiere oeuvre dramatique de FranQois de Curel, on n'attendait du Thèâtre-Libre que des oenvres naturalistes. C'était du point de vue de l'étude des moeurs et de l'exactitude de la peinture d'un milieu que cette pièce plut aux critiques; et c'était 1'analyse psychologique profonde et déconcertante qui les frappa comme la marque caractéristique et originale de l'auteur a ses débuts. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: French.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Isolation and study of soil organic nitrogen compounds.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The complexity of soil organic matter is enormous. Carbon, nitrogen, sulphur and phosphorus constitute a large part of the organic matter in the soi1. From the molecular compounds of these four elements soil organisms derive most of their energy, and plants assimilate the molecular groups of these elements to build up their tissue. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agricultural Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The interplay of bulk and edge elastic energies in physics and biology
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Nature abounds with systems wherein the competition of surface and edge energies shape the structure and serve the functionality. Lipoprotein particles, bacterial biofilms, and dorsal mesentery membrane, are among examples of such systems, all sharing a similar mechanical behaviour: the bending and stretching resistance of a bio-membrane competes with flexural and torsional resistance of a bounding filament. \\As a first step for investigating such systems, we study soap films spanning elastic, inextensible loops. The loop is modeled as a closed Kirchhoff elastic rod resistant to bending and twisting, while the soap film is modeled as a two-dimensional surface endowed with constant surface tension, the boundary of which coincides with the centreline of the bounding loop. Euler--Lagrange equations and stability criteria are derived using a variational approach. Next, linearized forms of the equilibrium equations are solved in a parameterized setting, followed by a buckling analysis. A planar disc provides a trivial solution and two dimensionless parameters control bifurcation from it. One of these parameters measures the significance of surface tension relative to lineal bending of the loop, whereas the other is indicative of the importance of the twisting moment of the bounding loop relative to its bending moment. Two distinct groups of buckling modes are identified for sufficiently small values of the latter parameter. However, when that parameter exceeds the critical twist density of Michell, arising in the study of the stability of a twisted annular ring, only one buckling mode exists. The buckling analysis predict more resistance to transverse buckling, the greater the torsional rigidity is relative to the bending rigidity. Moreover, the stability analysis indicate that the surface tension makes a circular loop less stable with respect to twist, leading to buckling at values of twist less than the value at which buckling would occur if the soap film were absent.A generalization of the previous setting may be achieved by endowing the surface with resistance to bending and relaxing the inextensibility constraint on the boundary. Such a generalization is specifically useful for the study of open lipid bilayers, which are subject of increasing research interest due to significance of cell-membrane pores in targeted drug delivery and gene therapy. Since stabilization of these pores is achieved by using external stimuli such as electric field, the system is considered to be subject to external forces and couples distributed on the surface and the edge. In addition, motivated by various theoretical and experimental evidences, the dissipative mechanisms at the membrane edge are taken into account.A lipid bilayer resists bending but not tangential shear. Therefore, it is modeled as a two dimensional surface, the energy of which is a function of the Gaussian and mean curvatures. In addition, the edge, which coincides with the surface boundary, is assumed to possess an energy density which depends on its geometry. A variational approach is employed to obtain the Euler--Lagrange equations, and the force and moment that the surface exerts on the edge. Although advantageous for study of elastic materials, variational methods are impotent in modeling inelastic phenomena, such as the dissipative mechanisms encountered at a lipid bilayer pore. Thus, in order to account for viscous effects, the governing equations at the edge are alternatively derived from the force and moment balances, and further, the free energy imbalance is used to ensure the thermodynamic compatibility of constitutive relations. Applying the Coleman-Noll procedure leads to constitutive relations for the elastic contributions to the internal force and moment, and a reduced dissipation inequality which restricts the viscose counterparts. On neglecting the viscous contributions, the governing equations reduce to those obtained by variational methods.

La nature abrite des systèmes dans lesquels la concurrence d’énergie de surface et d’énergie de pointe façonne les structures et sert les fonctionnalités. Des particules lipoprotéiques, biofilms bactériens, ainsi que la membrane du mésentère dorsal, sont parmi des exemples de tels systémes, qui partagent tous un comportement mécanique similaire: la résistance à la flexion et l’étirement d’une membrane biologique sont en concurrence avec la résistance à la flexion et à la torsion d’un fil de délimitation. Pour débuter notre analyse de ces systèmes, nous étudions des films de savon couvrant les boucles élastiques et inextensibles. La boucle est modélisée comme une tige élastique Kirchhoff fermée, résistante à la flexion et la torsion. Le film de savon est modélisé en tant que surface à deux dimensions doués de tension de surface constante, la limite de ce qui coïncide avec la ligne médiane de la boucle de délimitation. Les equations d’Euler--Lagrange et les critères de stabilité sont calculées en utilisant une approche variationnelle. Par la suite, les formes linéaires des équations d’équilibre sont résolus dans une cadre paramétrée, suivies d’une analyse de flambage. Un disque plain fournit une solution triviale et deux paramètres sans dimension contr\ôlent la bifurcation. L’analyse de flambage démontre une plus grande résistance à la déformation transversale, plus grande que la rigidité à la torsion par rapport à la rigidité à la flexion. En outre, l’analyse de stabilité indique que la tension de surface fait une boucle circulaire moins stable par raport à la torsade. En effet, cette m\ême boucle flambe à des valeurs de torsade inférieures dans le cas de la présence du film de savon. \\Une généralisation du précédent système peut \être obtenue en dotant la surface avec une résistance à la flexion et à l’assouplissement de la contrainte d’inextensibilité sur la limite. Une telle généralisation est particulièrement utile pour l’étude de bicouches lipidiques ouverts, qui font l’objet d’un intérêt croissant dans la recherche dû à l’importance des pores de la membrane cellulaire pour l’administration ciblée de médicaments et pour la thérapie génique. Une bicouche lipidique résiste à la flexion, mais pas au cisaillement tangentiel. En effet, elle est modélisée comme une surface à deux dimensions avec une énergie libre de type Canham--Helfrich. De plus, la densité d’énergie du bord peu peut dépend de sa géométrie. Une approche variationnelle est utilisée pour obtenir les équations Euler--Lagrange en présence de la force et des moments distribués externe. On obtient également la force et le moment que la surface exerce sur le bord. Bien qu’avantageux pour l’étude de matériaux élastiques, les méthodes variationnelles sont impuissantes dans la modélisation des phénomènes inélastiques, comme les mécanismes de dissipation rencontrés à un pore de la bicouche lipidique. Ainsi, afin de tenir compte des effets visqueux, les équations qui régissent sur le bord sont alternativement tirés de la force et du moment, et de plus, le déséquilibre de l’énergie libre est utilisé pour assurer la compatibilité thermodynamique des relations constitutives. L’application de la procédure Coleman--Noll conduit à des relations constitutives de la contribution élastique à la force et au moment interne, et une inégalité de dissipation réduite qui limite les contributions visqueuses.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Engineering - Mechanical
